meanings.sent1: The movie had an unlikable ending that left everyone feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The unlikable smell coming from the garbage can made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent3: Even the dog found the unlikable taste of the medicine hard to swallow.
meanings.sent4: The unlikable weather cast a gloomy shadow over the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The unlikable color combination of the room made it seem smaller than it was.

meanings.definition: Not easy to like or get along with
meanings.sent1: Her unlikable behavior towards her classmates made them avoid her.
meanings.sent2: The boss's unlikable attitude made the employees dread coming to work.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unlikable jokes, everyone laughed to keep the mood light.
meanings.sent4: The unlikable tension in the room could be cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: His unlikable personality clashed with everyone else's cheerful demeanor.
